The Story of the Elder Kilañjadāyaka
“In the past, in the delightful city of Tivarā,
I was a mat-maker then.
When Siddhattha, the Light of the World,
the people there were full of faith.
In order to worship the Lord of the World,
they were looking for grass-reeds;
while they were making an offering to the Buddha,
I gave them grass-reeds.
For ninety-four aeons,
the deed I did then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the result of giving grass-reeds.
For seven hundred and seventy aeons,
I was a king called Jaladdhara,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Kilañjadāyaka recited these verses.
